attributes.action: Nominate Tunstall Tower Square as a UNESCO World Heritage Site
attributes.background: Tunstall Tower Square in Stoke on Trent is an indicative example of Tower squares across the country. In an area of high cultural significance for the country and for the industrial revolution which changed the world forever the Tower Square should be protected.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of hard wired electrical accessories to the general public.
attributes.background: Many house fires and potentially dangeous situations regarding the electeical installations in dwellings are caused by poor workmanship on electrical installations. The main reason for this is due to the availability of hard wired accessories to the general public, who then fit them themselves
attributes.additional_details: Many people will not touch the plumbing in thier house due to the possibility of a leak thus causing damage, but will happily tamper with the electrical installation of their own homes and sometimes others as they believe they know what they are doing but in reality, do not have the slightest clue and are totally incompetent to touch such systems. These people are putting peoples lives at risk everyday and are able to do so as anybody can purchase the equipment without proof of competence to fit

attributes.action: British Parliament help ex-military to find accommodation after service
attributes.background: Quite a lot of the people who are homeless are ex-military who have found it impossible to find accommodation and cannot get on a housing list due to having no postal address.
attributes.additional_details: Too many of the homeless are ex-military and find there is insufficient help for them to find a home after finishing military service. Without a permanent address it is almost impossible  to gain employment .Often they end up sleeping on the streets and alcoholism is a real threat as their life descends into a feeling of hopelessness and despair. Will you sign this petition to ask our Government to ensure there is adequate help for them before they finish their military service .

attributes.action: Stop the College of Policing requiring Police to have a degree before joining.
attributes.background: The College of policing are requiring new officers to have a degree or a 3 year apprenticeship before joining. Currently there are around 38% of officers who have a degree. As a current special constable alot of the officers I serve with haven't got a degree and their policing skills are fantastic!

attributes.action: Make the HPV vaccine programme aimed towards both sexes instead of only females.
attributes.background: The HPV vaccine (the 'jab' females are highly recommended to get before sexual activity) is not only necessary for females but males as well to help prevent anal, throat and penile cancers, as well as over 100 types of HPV diseases.
attributes.additional_details: Males are not encouraged to receive this vaccine before sexual activity based on the logic that if females don't have the HPV infections then males won't receive them through sexual contact. This leaves males who have sex with males vulnerable to the infections as well as ignoring the benefits the injection has to prevent multiple cancers. The NHS has been encouraging this change for years yet no action has been taken, leaving males uneducated in the matter and at risk of major health hazards.

attributes.action: Compulsory cardiac screenings (once every 6 months) for those who do any sport.
attributes.background: Some people have have died whilst part taking in sports, such as Robin Chard aged 48 who died of cardiac arrest whilst cycling to raise money for a cancer charity.
attributes.additional_details: These are only a few examples listed, but if we had routine cardiac screenings these incidents would have been caught earlier and treatment would have been provided.

attributes.action: Campaign for greater involvement of the UK in the refugee resettlement
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is because we believe that the UK isn't allowing the enough number of refugees into the UK. Also we should be allowed to be part of the decision of allowing refugees in or not because at the end of the day it is the public who put decision makers in power.
attributes.additional_details: As we have put the decision makers in power they need to understand that without us they wouldn't be in power and also the reason they are in power is so that our voice can be heard.

attributes.action: Reduce fuel VAT to 5%
attributes.background: As energy VAT is at 5%; fuel such as petrol and diesel should also be reduced to 5% as they are also non-renewable energy sources.

attributes.action: Review funding into public services. Local authorities, NHS,police etc need help
attributes.background: Working in the public sector I have seen a decline in the last few years and knowing what future budgets hold I fear for communities. Had funding been correct over the years then there wouldn't be issues such as complaints on GP access or lack of bin collections etc
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence here is qualitative:
We all know someone who:

* Has struggled to see a doctor 
* Is homeless or can't get housing 
* Parents who scramble each year for a decent school place
* who is struggling to afford to eat
* works too many hours because they can't afford childcare 
* damaged a tyre due to pot holes in roads 
* Lack of landscaping 
* crime not responded too

attributes.action: Fly the Union Flag on Government Buildings on Armistice Day
attributes.background:
Current recommendations from the Department for Culture, Media and Sport do not require government buildings to fly the Union Flag on Armistice Day, 11th November.
It is recommended for Remembrance Sunday, but the omission of Armistice Day from the list is an oversight that should be corrected.
attributes.additional_details:
Armistice Day is 11 November. We pause to observe the Two Minute Silence at 11:00 on this day every year because at the 11th hour, on the 11th day of the 11th month in 1918, World War I ended. During this time, we remember those who have made sacrifices for the freedom we enjoy today.

The British Legion recommends flying the flag on Armistice Day.

http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/263/~/remembrance-faqs
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/designated-days-for-union-flag-flying

attributes.action: Pass a law that does what the Children & Young Persons Act 1933 is meant to do.
attributes.background: The Children & Young Persons Act 1933 says it is illegal for a child who is younger than 13, to assist in a non-performance trade or occupation carried on for profit. In many cases such as in research this law is not enforced. Therefore a fully enforceable law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Hundreds of thousands of children younger than 13 are employed in the UK in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy (ISBN1845298802). Child Employment Officers do not give them the protection they give children in performance work such as modelling & acting. Irrespective of the above Act the Officers do not regard them as being employed (NNCEE). This, and the lack of protection, undermines their rights as workers, and can result in them being mistreated & deprived of pay (ACAS).

attributes.action: Release Sharbat Gula
attributes.background:
The “Afghan Girl” who graced an iconic cover of National Geographic magazine in 1985 has been arrested in Pakistan on charges of being in the country illegally.

I call upon the UK government to ask for an immediate release of Sharbat Gula.

I request everyone to sign and share the petition.
attributes.additional_details: Sharbat Gula was 12 years old when she was photographed by Steve McCurry in a refugee camp in Pakistan, in December 1984. The haunting image of the green-eyed girl became an international symbol of refugees and of political and social unrest in the region. It has been widely reproduced, making her one of the most recognizable non-celebrity faces of the 20th century.

attributes.action: Adopt British summer Time from mid February to mid November.
attributes.background:
Almost nobody looks forward to the clocks going back, at the end of October, and despite this, we persist with this oppressive schedule.  
My proposal is to adopt BST from Mid Feb to mid Nov. shortening the dark winter evenings.  I believe this would be very good for national morale.
attributes.additional_details:
It is said that the mornings are too dark in Scotland.  On the current regime, it is broad daylight in Edinburgh at 8.00 am by the end of January.  As a Scot, I am sure that mid February would be a good moment to move to BST.  It is a long haul through to the end of March. 
 
Light at the end of the day is far more useful for healthy recreation and exercise, and environmentally, less energy would be used with lighter evenings, because more people are up and about in the afternoon.

attributes.action: The British Government should apologize for the Balfour Declaration.
attributes.background:
The British Government promised a land that was not in their possession. They should claim partial responsibility for the suffering of the Palestinian people. 
The Palestinian people deserve an apology.
attributes.additional_details:
The Palestinian people need support and Israel needs to be pressured. I believe we should have two states for two people. 
The British government needs to support the Palestinian people in their pursuit of statehood.
The best way to start will be by apologising to the Palestinian people.

attributes.action: Do not cut NHS unsociable hours pay.
attributes.background:
There is talk about fresh contracts to be implemented for the rest of the NHS staff. Due to the national shortage of healthcare professionals and workers, it would not be feasible to cut pay further. 
A lot of NHS staff rely on unsociable hours pay, to feed their families and so forth.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS needs a revamp and a boost, but not at the expense of front-line staff. It is not ideal to venture down this path and it would be an idea to explore other options, as opposed to cutting people's pay. The NHS also needs to encourage future employees and this is a solution, to a recruitment problem.

attributes.action: Immediately stop and cancel IHAT investigations into British troops
attributes.background: There are investigations into British troops conduct in the Gulf area.  These were initiated by Gordon Brown.  Some investigations are still ongoing and pending, it is totally unfair to do this, our troops are the best in the World and should not be investigated in this way.

attributes.action: Allow full legal costs to be taken into account by the Child Support Agency
attributes.background: When one partner decides to breakup a relationship and leave, taking the children and denying the other partner an acceptable level of access and/or communication, the only recourse the other partner has to achieve reasonable access to their children is to take very costly legal action.
attributes.additional_details: Also, if despite paying a reasonable level of maintenance based on previous household bills, the leaving partner uses the CSA to obtain the maximum possible then paying the resultant determination can drain any available funds to pay for legal costs. This creates a very uneven playing field and therefore, full legal costs should be taken into consideration by the CSA in order that a parent can legally fight for their rights.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to require disclosure of current  salary on a job application
attributes.background: Candidates are often dismissed as unsuitable if their current salary is more than 10% removed from the salary of the role they are applying for.  This discourages career advancement as well as job mobility between industries with different pay grades.  Candidates should be assessed on merit alone.
attributes.additional_details: Employers use current salary as a baseline to make an offer to a successful candidate, leading to a situation where two candidates can be paid vastly different amounts for the same role – this discourages social mobility and gender equality by ensuring that employees who are paid less than their colleagues are unable to catch up even when moving jobs.   Candidates can also fail to be considered for a role if their current salary is not in the same range as the role they are applying for.

attributes.action: Free sanitary products for public restrooms so homeless women can still get them
attributes.background: Homeless woman are less likely to get these products as they will have to choose between food or these products, if we had free ones in public restrooms it would help them in the long run.

attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Ban the release of Helium balloons
attributes.background:
Helium is a rare gas, which is becoming scarce, we allow people to release helium filled balloons for memorials/ celebrations / competitions. 
It causes major problems when the balloons deflate for wildlife and in particular aquatic animals. A number of whale deaths are recently attributed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://balloonsblow.org/
http://www.nabas.co.uk/about-balloons/
http://www.abc.net.au/science/surfingscientist/heliumballoons.htm
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/how-balloon-releases-harm-wildlife/
http://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

They are becoming part of the plastic soup we dump into out oceans killing wildlife we cannot continue like this, it a simple start please sign.

attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: The government should rethink its policies towards international students.
attributes.background:
A recent study* has shown that International Students make a net contribution of £2.3bn a year to the UK economy in London alone, as well as enhancing the UK's soft power globally.

However, the IPPR** claim current policy causes "unnecessary harm" to the UK's international education sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The IPPR*** make the following recommendations:
1. Students should be excluded from the drive to reduce net migration to tens of thousands.
2. The UK should set out a 10-year plan for expanding its international education sector.
3. The government should extend post-study work opportunities for international students.
4. Data collection methods should be improved to enable more robust assessment of migration patterns of international students.

* goo.gl/cT9o57
** goo.gl/R7Y8q3
*** goo.gl/7Nk9Vk

attributes.action: Make it law that all members of Parliament take regular drug and alcohol tests.
attributes.background: The government are accountable to the people and as most companies now test for drugs and alcohol so should Parliament as they shouldn't be running as ministers if under the influence

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016.
attributes.background:
Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016. Legal highs have been around for 20 years until the unsubstantiated hype of dangers.

We are in an era where countries are criminalising drugs and with this act the UK has gone backwards because of unsubstantiated hype.
attributes.additional_details:
We now know that former legal highs are available illegally and have become more dangerous. The industry still exists. It is wasting police time and resources when we should be focusing on terror and more important matters. Even the UN says drugs should be decriminalised.

UK Parliament has made more people into criminals when it is supposed to be criminal justice reform. The Equalities Commission & the PM said coloured people are more likely to go to jail this is racist legislation.

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: Government to reform the honours system to include posthumous awards
attributes.background: I'm creating this petition to call upon the Government to reform the honours system, so that knighthoods can be awarded posthumously. Its a shame that people that have contributed something for the country but are sadly no longer with us cannot be recognised for their achievements.
attributes.additional_details: A prime example is Bobby Moore. Its now the 50th anniversary of the year of England winning the world cup. He was a leader, a gentleman and credit to this country. Geoff Hurst has been knighted so surely Bobby Moore should be too (posthumously) as he was the Captain of the team, especially in this anniversary year. It would be a very fitting way to celebrate the achievement of the the man and the team.

attributes.action: To support a longer cease-fire in Syria to allow for food and medical aid
attributes.background: After the recent effects of the bombing in Aleppo, Syria, I would like to propose that we support a longer cease-fire to allow for key medical supplies to reach those who have been effected by War.
attributes.additional_details: In previous months the cease-fire has been only 48 hours, however this is too short a period of time for supplies to get to those who need it and to recover from the effects of injury, loss of home and even separation from loved ones.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Create a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction.
attributes.background: M25 is a nightmare for commuters especially during peak hours. Commuters waste precious time sitting in long traffic queues around the  junctions such as J27, J21, J16, J15, J12 and Dartford crossing. Traffic on M25 is also adding to vehicular pollution.
attributes.additional_details: Creating a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction would ease the traffic on M25 and reduce vehicular pollution. This outer circle can then connect to all major train line that go into the Central London areas or going to other areas of the Country. Ample parking in these train stations will allow commuters to drive into the nearest station and hop onto trains. Local businesses around the train station will also benefit from the new investment.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: Make the swegway/hoverboard no longer governed by the highways act of 1835.
attributes.background: The highways act of 1835 was clearly not written with the swegway in mind. They are smaller than a baby's pram and a disability scooter and people are allowed to use them in public, so it is unjust for the swegway to be singled out and banned in public places.
attributes.additional_details: At the very least they should be legal in public parks as bikes, being much faster than a swegway, are allowed to be in parks but swegways are not.

attributes.action: Remove roadside signs supported on steel girders
attributes.background: As a retained firefighter for Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service I have recently attended  an rtc where a van came into contact with a roadside motorway sign which was mounted on steel girders. This collision left the driver with life changing injuries. There are a number of these signs on the m3.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the construction of these signs is a danger to life and there appears to be more lightweight options available that are in use in other areas of the motorway system. A vehicle coming into contact with these signs supported on steel girders will quiet simply be cut in half by the force of the collision. I recently attended an incident on the m3 near Basingstoke where a driver lost a leg.

attributes.action: Tighten regulation on news media to prevent the manipulation of public opinion.
attributes.background: The recent referendum showed that some newspapers were heavily pushing their readership to vote a specific way, readers who only used those newspapers to make their decision may have voted without balanced arguments and hence may have been subject to manipulation of opinion by the newspaper itself.
attributes.additional_details: All news media organisations that publish in the public domain should hold a responsibility to provide a balanced view, rather than only printing facts or opinion that support the organisations own stance. The impartiality rules that govern the BBC’s political stance, should be considered for the rest of the news media organisations. The public needs to be provided with balanced facts and opinions to allow them to make their own decisions, rather than be steered by an organisations own view.

attributes.action: Make all forms of non-medical genital mutilation of minors illegal
attributes.background: Any genital mutilation (GM) of boys and girls, even if they supposedly give consent, should be made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: GM for religious reasons is particularly heinous as it permanently marks the child as a member of a religion into which no child can be born only inculcated.

attributes.action: Compel energy providers to offer the cheapest tariffs on pre-pay meters.
attributes.background: Users of pre-pay meters are unfairly disadvantaged when purchasing energy to heat their homes. Although often on lower incomes they actually have to pay a higher rate. This is "fuel poverty" - higher tariffs result in people going without food or other essentials as they just try to keep warm.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/19/fuel-poverty-heating-disabled-cold-penalised-energy-tariff

attributes.action: Provide funding to migrate all NHS systems from Windows XP for security reasons
attributes.background: Barts NHS trust has just been hit with a ransomware attack, it was running Windows XP. 30 percent of all NHS trusts have been hit by ransomware according to an FOI request by Sentinel One. Moving off Windows XP is efficient, Imperial College NHS Trust found they cut help desk calls by 60 percent.
attributes.additional_details:
Upgrade from Windows XP would be a good start but proper endpoint security is needed to protect against ransomware. Dynamic endpoint protection and DNS level filtering. Anti malware and anti exploit protection is also necessary. 
http://www.computing.co.uk/ctg/news/3002565/barts-nhs-trust-windows-xp-pcs-infected-with-suspected-ransomware 
http://www.dclsearch.com/nhs-trusts-a-magnet-for-ransomware-foi-disclosures-reveal-it-security-news/ 
http://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/01/17/nhs_ransomware/

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Fully fund A&E and urgent care by a specific A&E tax paid by most people.
attributes.background: There is national alarm at the state of many A and E departments with excessive waiting times and some inappropriate use by people who should be treated elsewhere. Separate funding paid for fully by a broad based tax to which most if not all contribute is needed to provide sufficient urgent care.
attributes.additional_details:
Refer to sensible views of Philippa Whitford in the NHS and Social Care funding in the House of Commons on Jan 11th 2017. She presents the impressive model as practised in Scotland.
Everyone knows that A and E is not coping in many parts of the country. This is exacerbated by the lack of GP availability out of hours and at weekends. Demand has risen due to an ageing population and lack of alternative facilities. A and E is one of the few services that virtually everybody will use in their lives.

attributes.action: Award a campaign medal for members of Bomber Command in WW2.
attributes.background: 55,573 members of Bomber Command were killed in WW2 and have never received any official recognition for their sacrifice. It is time this injustice was corrected.

attributes.action: To make a ban on eating disorder websites or videos as this destroys lives.
attributes.background: This is something that effects me. I think that promoting the way doing eating disorders is disgusting and should be a crime as it affects lives. I have seen all these websites where they tell best was to purge (throwing up food). This is horrible and needs to stop as this is killing people.
attributes.additional_details: The are many horrible web sites like these that need to be banned as they are destroying lives and families. Please help me stop these horrible websites as they are messing peoples lives.

attributes.action: Impose minimum standards for UK phone network providers to meet.
attributes.background: Having tried several networks over the years I found that non of our providers can supply a minimum standard phone signal across Norfolk, yet we are now being told about 5G most of us bearly get signal for a call or text or 2G. Our phones are for our safety and with no signal we are not safe.

attributes.action: Make it 'illegal' to setup None Legal Encampment's, with the Police given Powers
attributes.background:
The Police must be given the Powers to Remove people as they Arrive, it should not be for the Councils and Land Owners to Waste money taking Action, also any Mess/Damage must be got from the ones who caused it like breaking in, and Human Waste.
At this time it is Unfair that Council Money is Waste
attributes.additional_details:
Some in the Traveling sector cause issues with Locals, Fly Tip, our council plus the City council have had to pay out good money in Repairs with one area which a school uses closed for eight days cleaning up their mess and repairs to the grass area, another they lifted out posts to a play area, cut chains on gates Only to be moved on to do the same again, No Law in this practice.

Let's make the Laws apply to All.

attributes.action: Protect Local Authority centrally held funding for Early Years Intervention
attributes.background:
Government changes to Early Years centrally held funding are threatening the existence of the outstanding Pen Green Centre, a pioneer in early years integration. 
NCC funds the majority of the centre's work via the centrally held fund and changes will inadvertently see a savage reduction in budget.
attributes.additional_details:
We know DfE did not intend to threaten the country’s largest and most innovative nursery school.
Whilst we support the principle of funds being redirected to the front line we urgently request the government ring-fence funds for Pen Green and other integrated nursery schools before February 2017. 

Furthermore we urge the government to enact a caveat to the future funding arrangements whereby integrated nursery schools are protected financially to continue their outstanding work from hereon in.

attributes.action: Give HMRC more funding to help stamp out tax evasion.
attributes.background: Tax fraud costs the government  £16bn every year. HMRC are making cuts to "save money" in reality these job losses are hurting the economy. Tax avoidance is hurting services like the NHS and is leading to low earning citizens having to pay higher taxes. Sign to make the government give more funding.

attributes.action: Make Personal Development classes part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Sources suggest that on average, children spend just under 800 hours in a classroom each year! During this time a range of subjects will be taught and skills will be gained. However, in the midst of Maths, Science, PE and others, when do you hear kids shouting "I'm off to Personal Development Class"
attributes.additional_details:
I do not have an issue with the standard of education our children get, but I want them to have an opportunity each week to work on Developing themselves, to learn and build on attributes such as Resilience, Self Motivation and Empathy to name a few. 

“A teacher has two jobs: fill young minds with knowledge, yes, but more important, give those minds a compass so that that knowledge doesn't go to waste.” - Mr Hollands Opus 1995 (movie)

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!
